revision.text:
{{Infobox award | name = Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards | current_awards = Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2017 | image = Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards (ASFA) Logo.jpg | imagesize = | caption = | sponsor = [[Cîroc]] | presenter = Abryanz Collection | description = Excellence and outstanding achievement in the [[fashion]] industry in Africa | country = Uganda | year = 2013 | network = NTV Uganda | website = {{URL|abryanzstyleandfashionawards.com}} }} {{Infobox election | election_name = Most recent Abryanz Style and Fashion Award winners | election_date = [[Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2017|Best in Fashion 2017]] | type = primary | ongoing = no | previous_election = Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2016 | previous_year = 2016 | next_election = Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2018 | next_year = 2018 | opinion_polls = | 1blank = Award | 2blank = Winner | image1 = | 1data1 = Male Most Stylish/Dressed Celebrity | 2data1 = [[Idris Sultan]] | image2 = | 1data2 = Most Stylish Male Artiste | 2data2 = [[Bebe Cool]] | image4 = | 1data4 = Best Female Dressed Media Personality | 2data4 = Bettinah Tianah | image5 = | 1data5 = Fashionable Music Video of the Year | 2data5 = [[Mafikizolo]]
''(Love portion)'' | title = Lifestyle/Style Fashion Icon Achievement Award | before_election = "[[David Tlale]]" | after_election = "[[Mai Atafo]]" }} The '''Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards''', also known as the '''ASFAs''', are continental fashion awards presented annually in Uganda by Abryanz Collection to recognize excellence and outstanding achievement in the [[fashion]] industry in Uganda and Africa.{{cite web |title=Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2017 rock Kampala |url=https://www.newvision.co.ug/new_vision/news/1467349/abryanz-style-fashion-awards-2017-rock-kampala |website=New Vision |accessdate=30 June 2018}} ==History== Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards were established in 2013 by fashion stylist and proprietor of Abryanz Collection Brian Ahumuza in Uganda. The inaugural event was held at MTN Arena in [[Lugogo, Kampala]], with subsequent events held at the Serena Hotel in Kampala. The awards started with a focus on Ugandan fashion, and categories for the rest of Africa were added in 2016.{{cite web |title=ABRYANZ STYLE & FASHION AWARDS |url=http://www.btendancewebzine.com/article/abryanz-style-fashion-awards/ |website=Btendancewebzine |accessdate=1 July 2018}} The category of Lifetime / Style Fashion Icon Achievement, which is not voted for, is awarded to an individual for their significant contribution to the fashion industry. It was awarded to [[Princess Elizabeth of Toro]] (Uganda) in 2015,{{cite web |title=Princess Elizabeth Bagaya receives Lifetime Style & Fashion Icon Achievement Award 2015. |url=https://bigeye.ug/princess-elizabeth-bagaya-receives-lifetime-style-fashion-icon-achievement-award-2015/ |website=Big Eye |accessdate=1 July 2018}} and [[Mai Atafo]] (Nigeria) in 2017.{{cite web |title=International Designer Mai Atafo Wins Lifetime Style And Fashion Icon Achievement |url=https://guardian.ng/life/international-designer-mai-atafo-wins-lifetime-style-and-fashion-icon-achievement/ |website=The Guardian |accessdate=1 July 2018}} The awards are broadcast live on NTV Uganda.{{cite web |title=Abryanz fashion take over set for December |url=http://www.thecitizen.co.tz/magazine/thebeat/Abryanz-fashion-take-over-set-for-December/1843792-4035746-xmp4mc/index.html |website=The Citizen |accessdate=2 July 2018}} ==Occurrences== {|class="wikitable" !Event Year !Venue !Host(s) |- |[[Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2017]] |rowspan="4"|[[Kampala Serena Hotel|Serena Hotel Kampala]] |[[Rachel K (musician)|Rachel K]]
Nana Akua Ado |- |[[Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2016]] |[[Vimbai Mutinhiri]]
[[Idris Sultan]] |- |Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2015{{cite web |title=Uganda: Abryanz style and Fashion Awards 2015 |url=http://www.eleksie.co.ke/abryanz-style-and-fashion-awards-2015/ |website=Eleksie Kenya |accessdate=1 July 2018}} |[[Vera Sidika]]
[[Gaetano Kagwa]] |- |Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2014{{cite web |title=Roger Mugisha, Judith Heard and Jackie O to host Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards |url=http://chano8.com/roger-mugisha-judith-heard-jackie-o-host-abryanz-fashion-awards/ |website=Chano8 |accessdate=1 July 2018}} |Roger Mugisha
Judith Heard
Jackie O |- |Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards 2013 |MTN Arena, Lugogo |Jackie O |- |} ==Categories== Each category offers two awards for both Ugandan and continental winners except the Lifetime/Style Fashion Icon Achievement Award. The public votes for the nominees and the public takes 40 percent and the awards academy judges take the 60 percent. Voting by the public has been done online on the official awards website and on social media.{{cite web |title=Abryanz Style & Fashion Awards |url=https://www.kenyanvibe.com/abryanz-fashion-style-awards/ |website=Kenyan Vibe |accessdate=1 July 2018}} {{columns-list|colwidth=20em| * Lifetime/Style Fashion Icon Achievement Award * Designer of the year * Male Model of the year * Female Model of the year * Male Most Stylish/Dressed Celebrity * Female Most Stylish/Dressed Celebrity * Most Stylish Male Artiste * Most Stylish Female Artiste * Most Male Dressed Media personality * Best Female Dressed Media personality * Male Fashionista of the year * Female Fashionista of the year * Hair Stylist of the year * Makeup Artist of the year * Fashion Photographer of the year * Stylist of the year * Fashionable Music video of the year * Fashion Blogger of the year }} ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == {{commons}} * {{Official website|https://abryanzstyleandfashionawards.com}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abryanz Style and Fashion Awards, ASFAs, Abryanz Awards}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Ugandan awards]] [[Category:Fashion awards]] [[Category:African awards]] [[Category:Annual events in Uganda]] [[Category:Fashion events in Africa]]

Development Front]] * {{flagicon image|Logo of Jaysh al-Islam.jpg}} [[Jaysh al-Islam]] * [[Al-Tawhid Brigade]] * 1st Regiment |strength1={{flagicon image|Syrian Armed Forces Flag.svg}} 1,000+ regular soldiers{{cite web|url=http://www.wsoctv.com/news/syria-tv-rebel-shelling-in-aleppo-kills-3-children-1-adult/462051528|title=Syria rebels keep up offensive on western Aleppo|author=AP|publisher=WSOCTV|accessdate=30 October 2016}}
[[File:Emblem of Liwa Al-Quds.svg|18px]] 1,200–6,500 Liwa Al-Quds fighters{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/thousands-pro-government-reinforcements-sent-west-aleppo-reports/|title=Thousands of pro-government reinforcements sent to west Aleppo: reports|work=al-Masdar News|author=Leith Fadel|date=3 November 2016}} |strength2=2,000–6,500 fighters{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/29/Battle-for-Aleppo-Summary-Day-1|title=Battle for Aleppo Summary: Day 1|work=The Inside Source|date=29 October 2016}}
[https://forum.krstarica.com/showthread.php/750242-Rat-u-Siriji-i-Iraku-vesti-i-analize/page694]{{better source|dead link and forum|date=August 2018}}
22 [[main battle tank]]s{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/middleeast/201611011046945033-moderate-opposition-shells-aleppo/|title=Over 2,000 'Moderates' Shell Aleppo Using 45 Vehicles - Russian MoD|first=|last=Sputnik|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}}{{better source|Is there a more reliable source for this?|date=August 2018}}
15 [[infantry fighting vehicle]]s{{better source|Is there a more reliable source for this?|date=August 2018}} |casualties1=165 killed, 200–300+ wounded (per the Inside Source)[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/797327204489129984] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/797772005026037760]{{better source|social media|date=August 2018}}
152 killed (per the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights|SOHR]])[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54460 209 killed yesterday including 70 regime forces] |casualties2=297 killed, 350–400+ wounded (per the Inside Source)[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/797326922434740224] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/797445401578045440]{{better source|social media|date=August 2018}}
260 killed (per the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights|SOHR]]) |casualties3=96–127 civilians killed{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/middleeast/201611031047025865-militants-aleppo-offensive/|title=Militants Launch Offensive in Aleppo During Humanitarian Pause, Kill 127 People|first=|last=Sputnik|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} | campaignbox = {{Campaignbox Syrian Civil War}}{{Campaignbox Battle of Aleppo}} }} The '''Aleppo offensive of October–November 2016''', named the '''"Battle of the Hero Martyr Abu Omar Saraqib"''' by the [[Army of Conquest]], refers to a military operation launched on the western outskirts of [[Aleppo]] at the end of October 2016 by rebel forces in [[Syria]], against the [[Syria]]n government forces and its allies. The aim of the offensive was to establish a new supply line into Aleppo city, after an [[2016 Aleppo campaign|Army-initiated summer campaign]] had cut off all rebel access to Aleppo. The rebels called the operation "the mother of all battles", or "the grand battle of Aleppo", and described it as possibly deciding the outcome of the war.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/amp/news/2016/10/syrian-rebels-launch-aleppo-counterattack-161028081848190.html|title=Syrian rebels launch Aleppo counterattack|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/10/islamists-hit-syrian-army-convoy-near-aleppo-dozens-killed/|title=Islamists rebels hit Syrian Army convoy bound for Aleppo, dozens killed - ARA News|date=30 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.newsweek.com/syrian-rebels-push-west-against-assad-forces-aleppo-515958|title=Syrian rebels push West against Assad forces in Aleppo|date=1 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}} After making early advances, the rebel offensive soon slowed and stalled.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKBN13709H|title=Syrian army and allies make gains in Aleppo|date=12 November 2016|publisher=|via=Reuters}} By mid-November, government troops regained control of all areas lost at the start of the rebel offensive, as well as areas lost in the [[Aleppo offensive (July–August 2016)|earlier rebel offensive]] during the summer campaign. ==The offensive== [[File:16alep1.png|thumb|left|Map of the rebel offensive]] On 28 October, rebel forces outside Aleppo fired more than 150 shells, mainly [[BM-21 Grad]] rockets, at western Aleppo and the [[Aleppo International Airport]], killing more than 15 civilians and wounding at least 100.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-offensive-idUSKCN12S0QP|title=Syria monitor group says rebel shelling kills more than 15 in west Aleppo|work=Reuters|date=28 October 2016}} Rebel groups then announced that they had begun an offensive against the city after detonating three suicide [[car bomb]]s,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53401 3 suicide car attacks target regime forces in Aleppo leading to violent clashes] one of which was a tank driven by a French [[Jabhat Fateh al-Sham]] [[suicide bomber]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37798924|title=Syrian rebels 'start Aleppo offensive'|work=BBC|date=28 October 2016}} The Army also reportedly destroyed two or four other car bombs.{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/28/Rebels-Launch-Huge-Battle-For-West-Aleppo|title=Rebels Launch Huge Battle For West Aleppo!|publisher=The Inside Source}} Rebels in tanks, armored vehicles, bulldozers, makeshift mine sweepers, pick-up trucks and on motorcycles approached the city.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-offensive-idUSKCN12S0QP|title=Syrian rebels launch Aleppo counter-attack to break siege|date=28 October 2016|publisher=|via=Reuters}} The offensive took place along a 15-kilometer stretch of the frontline.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53420 Rebels advance over regime forces in Aleppo] Following the attack by the suicide-bombers on the western outskirts of the city, the rebels seized the Minyan Sawmills, Al-Surah Checkpoint,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jaysh-al-fateh-launches-massive-offensive-break-aleppo-siege/|title=Jaysh Al-Fateh launches massive offensive to break Aleppo siege|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=28 October 2016|publisher=}}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53411 15 killed while 100 injured by missiles targeted western Aleppo] the Cardboard Factory and most of the Dahiyat Al-Assad suburb,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53434 The Factions win the first round of the grand battle of Aleppo and control most of al-Assad Suburb]{{Cite web|url=http://orient-news.net/en/news_show/125981/0/Opposition-captures-a-group-of-Hezbollah-Harakat-al-Nujaba-mercenaries-in-Aleppo|title=Opposition captures a group of Hezbollah, Harakat al-Nujaba mercenaries in Aleppo|last=|first=|date=28 October 2016|website=Orient News|publisher=|access-date=}} while government troops withdrew to the eastern side of the district so they would not be overrun.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jaysh-al-fateh-seizes-large-suburb-west-aleppo/|title=Jaysh Al-Fateh seizes large suburb in west Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=28 October 2016|publisher=}} Concurrently, a rebel attack from the southwest in the area of the 1070 Housing Project was repelled, with one rebel tank destroyed and the Army retaining its presence in the northeast section of the Housing Project. Rebel attacks on the nearby 3000 Housing Project and the northwestern Zahra district were also repelled.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/battle-aleppo-heats-syrian-army-stops-islamist-offensive-tracks/|title=Battle for Aleppo heats up as the Syrian Army stops Islamist offensive in its tracks|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=28 October 2016|publisher=}} In all, up to eight car bombs, some remotely controlled, were detonated or destroyed at the start of the offensive. In the evening, the Army launched several surface-to-surface missiles on rebel positions in the west of the city.{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=792165832570773504|date=29 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // SAA launched several large Surface to surface missiles onto rebel positions across Western Aleppo just now.}} The next day, government forces launched a counter-attack{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-10-29/syria-gov-launch-offensive-against-rebels/7977808|title=Syrian government forces launch counter-offensive against Aleppo rebels|date=29 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}} against Minyan Industrial and Dahiyat Al-Assad districts. Fighting also took place at the 1070 Housing Project.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53471 Regime forces attempt to regain control of areas they lost in the first round of Aleppo battle] Later, the rebels started shelling the Hamdaniyah district, in preparation for a new assault, and soon after a suicide car bomb exploded near the Zahra district.[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792315154503393280] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792315412020989952] The assault against Zahra was eventually repelled,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/islamist-rebels-attack-along-entire-frontline-western-aleppo-map-update/|title=Islamist rebels attack along the entire frontline in western Aleppo - Map update|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=29 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=792355541876039681|date=29 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Rebel attack on the Zahra front has been halted. Dozen rebel casualties at least.|accessdate=31 October 2016}} while government troops managed to retake several positions in Dahiyat Al-Assad, where a second suicide car bombing of the day took place.[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/29/جمعية-الزهراء-تشهد-المعارك-الأعنف-وال/ جمعية الزهراء تشهد المعارك الأعنف والأضخم وضربات جوية وصاروخية مكثفة ترافق الاشتباكات المتواصلة في ثاني أيام معركة حلب] However, by the evening, the rebels managed to take control of the Minyan residential district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/aleppo-battle-syrian-army-regains-minyan-amid-intensifying-battles-map-update/|title=Aleppo Battle: Syrian Army regains Minyan amid intensifying battles. Map Update|first=Zen|last=Adra|date=30 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=31 October 2016}} Over the next two days, back and forth fighting took place{{cite web|url=http://syriadirect.org/news/regime-rebel-forces-grind-into-third-day-of-fight-for-aleppo-city/|title=Regime, rebel forces grind into third day of fight for Aleppo city|publisher=|accessdate=31 October 2016}} at the Minyan district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-retakes-crucial-district-western-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army retakes crucial district in western Aleppo|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=29 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/30/قوات-النظام-تعاود-التقدم-في-منطقة-منيا/ قوات النظام تعاود التقدم في منطقة منيان بأطراف حلب الغربية وقصف بمئات القذائف استهدف المدينة وجبهات القتال اليوم][https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792477127119474688] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792839597105348608] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/793078797520076800] and as of 31 October, control of the district was divided in half.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-attempt-recapture-lost-territory-west-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah attempt to recapture lost territory in west Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=31 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} During this time, the Army had also conducted a new counter-attack against Dahiyat Al-Assad.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-begins-counter-assault-key-suburb-southwest-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army begins counter-assault at key suburb in southwest Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=792498244777488384|date=29 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Fresh reports of elite SAA units beginning to counter at AlAssad are true. Heavy clashes beginning to ignite once more.|accessdate=31 October 2016}} The rebels also launched their own assault on the New Aleppo district{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=792528951683932161|date=30 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Fierce clashes erupt as rebels begin storming 'New Aleppo' .|accessdate=31 October 2016}} and the 1070 and 3000 Housing Projects, where two suicide car bombers blew themselves up.[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792659479691005952] [https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/792662740435292160] A rebel tank and a [[Technical (vehicle)|technical]] were destroyed in the fighting at the 3000 Housing Project.{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=792683647392329728|date=30 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Rebel tank taken out near the 3000 apartment area alongside a mounted technical.|accessdate=31 October 2016}} During the clashes, the rebels reportedly shelled a residential area of the Hamdaniyah district with chlorine gas,{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-gas-idUKKBN12U0E8?il=0|title=Aleppo fighting spreads amid accusations of gas attack|first=Suleiman Al-Khalidi and Tom|last=Perry|publisher=|accessdate=31 October 2016}} leaving one civilian dead and 15 people injured.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/aleppo-update-rebels-use-poisonous-gas-battles-intensify/|title=Aleppo Update: Rebels use poisonous gas as battles intensify|first=Zen|last=Adra|date=30 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=31 October 2016}} The rebels denied this and claimed government forces had themselves used poison gas at one point of the frontline. Ultimately, the rebel attack on the 3000 Housing Project as well as the nearby military complex was repelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/syria-rebel-assault-break-aleppo-siege-slows-161031130219379.html|title=Syria: Rebel assault to break Aleppo siege slows|publisher=|accessdate=31 October 2016}} By 31 October, the rebel offensive had slowed due to heavy government resistance and pro-government forces had taken the initiative. Three days into the offensive, the rebels were in control of the Minyan Industrial district, most of the Dahiyat Al-Assad district and half of the Minyan residential district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/2nd-phase-battle-aleppo-begins-suicide-bombers-attack-syrian-army/|title=2nd phase of battle for Aleppo begins as suicide bombers attack the Syrian Army|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=3 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} The frontline had stabilized{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=793235200452857856|date=31 October 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Front lines have stabilised, no notable change in territorial control over the last day.|accessdate=5 November 2016}} and settled into a stalemate.{{cite web|url=http://syriadirect.org/news/aleppo%E2%80%99s-hamdaniyah-district-unwilling-frontline-in-newest-assault-on-regime-held-west/|title=Aleppo’s Hamdaniyah district unwilling frontline in newest assault on regime-held west|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} Since the start of the offensive, the rebels had used 12 suicide car bombers in their attacks.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53595 Jaish al-Fateh announces the end of the first round and issues a “recommendations”, Muhaysini incites for fighting] On 3 November, the rebels launched the second phase of their offensive, with a triple suicide-bombing against Army positions in the western part of the New Aleppo district and at the Minyan district, in an attempt to revitalize the operation since it had made little progress after the first day.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/reuters/article-3902020/Rebels-step-Aleppo-offensive-three-car-bombs.html|title=Rebels step up Aleppo offensive with three car bombs|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} They managed to advance and capture several positions.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/no-russian-air-presence-aleppo-despite-massive-jihadist-attack/|title=No Russian air presence in Aleppo despite massive jihadist attack|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=3 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} The rebels also assaulted the 3000 Housing Project and the Al-Assad Military Academy.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/islamist-rebels-rain-missiles-residential-neighbourhoods-western-aleppo/|title=Islamist rebels rain missiles over residential neighbourhoods in western Aleppo|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=3 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}} During the clashes, another rebel tank was destroyed,{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=794117910545321984|date=3 November 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Rebel tank taken out in Al Assad suburb.|accessdate=5 November 2016}} as well as two Army anti-tank positions. Still, the rebels were not able to break into New Aleppo{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=794140451691298816|date=3 November 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Rebels have not entered New Aleppo as of now. Situation is tense and clashes are ongoing.|accessdate=5 November 2016}} and their assault was repelled.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/islamist-offensive-syrian-army-positions-western-aleppo-ends-disaster/|title=Islamist offensive on Syrian Army positions in western Aleppo ends in disaster|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=3 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=5 November 2016}}[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/794287258136289280] [https://twitter.com/Syria_Rebel_Obs/status/794277862132088832] [[File:16alep2.png|thumb|left|Map of the government counteroffensive]] On 6 November, Army special forces and Hezbollah militiamen launched a counter-attack on the southwestern edge of Aleppo, advancing in the area of Al-Mutha hill and the 1070 Housing Project.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-gains-ground-western-aleppo-tiger-forces-launch-counter-offensive/|title=Syrian Army gains ground in western Aleppo as Tiger Forces launch counter-offensive|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=6 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}}{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=795366684001304576|date=6 November 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Hezbollah & SAA special forces are now advancing in South Aleppo, onto Tel Mutah.|accessdate=8 November 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54062 30 killed in Aleppo and continued clashes in the city] The next day, government forces broke through the rebel's first line of defense on Tal Rakhem hill,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-resumes-offensive-operations-southwest-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army resumes offensive operations in southwest Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=7 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}} making advances,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54077 Continued clashes in Aleppo and 36 killed in the past 48 hours] while also seizing six buildings in the 1070 Housing Project.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-advances-southwest-aleppo-district/|title=Syrian Army advances in southwest Aleppo district|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=7 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}}{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=795603039474229249|date=7 November 2016|title=You heard it here first, hours ago. SAA made some advances in the 1070 area.|accessdate=8 November 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/11/07/قوات-النظام-تحقق-تقدماً-في-أطراف-مشروع-1/ قوات النظام تحقق تقدماً في أطراف مشروع 1070 شقة ومزيد من الشهداء في قذائف على القسم الغربي من المدينة] Later that day, government forces further advanced in the area and managed to impose fire control over the nearby al-Hikmah school.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54120 Regime’s Helicopters and warplanes raid Aleppo city and its western countryside and violent clashes at the outskirts and western outskirts of the city] On 8 November, government troops fully captured the 1070 Housing Project, as well as three nearby hills. The rebels additionally withdrew from al-Hikmah school, so to regroup at the Rashiddeen 5 Suburb, but the Army had not yet reached the school due to heavy rebel shelling.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKBN133125|title=Syrian army says takes Aleppo district, rebels say battle continues|date=8 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016|via=Reuters}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/latest-battlefield-update-southwest-aleppo-map/|title=Latest battlefield update from southwest Aleppo: map|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=8 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-capture-territory-southwest-aleppo-jihadist-defenses-crumble/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah capture more territory in southwest Aleppo as jihadist defenses crumble|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=8 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}} Later, government troops launched a large assault inside the Dahiyat Al-Assad and Minyan districts, recapturing Minyan and reportedly advancing inside Dahiyat Al-Assad.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-launches-major-assault-west-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army launches major assault on west Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=8 November 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016}} That night, the rebels managed to recapture the western half of Minyan.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54201 The regime forces and militiamen loyal to them retreat to east of Menyan after fierce clash against the factions and Fatah al-Sham] The next day, government troops seized the strategic Hikmah school and secured the Hikmah area, while they made their first push towards the Rashiddeen 5 and Aqrab districts in southwest Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-strategic-area-southwest-aleppo-jihadists-continue-mass-retreat/|title=Syrian Army captures strategic area in southwest Aleppo as jihadists continue mass retreat|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=9 November 2016|publisher=}}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54235 Attempts by the regime to advance in western Aleppo after taking over al-Hekma school]{{cite web|url=https://www.alaraby.co.uk/english/news/2016/11/10/regime-advances-in-aleppo-amid-worlds-preoccupation-with-trump|title=Regime advances in Aleppo amid world's preoccupation with Trump|first=The New Arab &|last=agencies|publisher=}} Later, government troops made their first assault against the Rashiddeen 5 and Aqrab districts in southwest Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/latest-battlefield-update-southwest-aleppo-map-2/|title=Latest battlefield update from southwest Aleppo: map|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=9 November 2016|publisher=}} On 10 November, government troops recaptured half of the Dahiyat Al-Assad district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-seizes-half-al-assad-suburb-west-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army seizes half of Al-Assad Suburb in west Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}} including the Science Academy and nearby church.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-breaks-jihadist-lines-western-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army breaks through jihadist lines in western Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=10 November 2016|publisher=}} Violent clashes continued between government troops and the rebels in the western part of the district, around the Sourah and Shair checkpoints.[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/11/10/تواصل-الاشتباكات-العنيفة-في-القسم-الش/ تواصل الاشتباكات العنيفة في القسم الشرقي من ضاحية الأسد بأطراف حلب الجنوبية الغربية] The next day, the rebels recaptured all areas lost in Dahiyat Al-Assad,{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=797019937415909376|date=11 November 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // Rebels regained complete control of the Al Assad suburb after pushing back advancing SAA infantry.}}[http://www.nbn.com.lb/الجيش-السوري-يسيطر-على-المثلث-الجنوبي/ الجيش السوري يسيطر على المثلث الجنوبي من ضاحية الاسد بحلب] but a new Army attack on the district was soon under way{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=797064011032317952|date=11 November 2016|title=#Syria // #Aleppo // SAA once again attempting to seize the Al Assad suburb. Heavy clashes continue.}} and they once again regained several areas.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-3926588/Russia-says-militants-used-chemical-weapons-Syria.html|title=Russia, Syria's rebels clash on chemical weapons use claims|publisher=}} In an attempt to stop the Army's counter-attack, the rebels sent reinforcements.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jaysh-al-fateh-reinforcements-arrive-west-aleppo-stop-syrian-army-offensive/|title=Jaysh Al-Fateh reinforcements arrive to west Aleppo to stop Syrian Army offensive|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}} Concurrently, government forces recaptured the entire Minyan residential district after breaking the rebel's last line of defense.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-key-aleppo-suburb-jihadist-defenses-collapse/|title=Syrian Army captures key Aleppo suburb after jihadist defenses collapse|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/11/12/8-شهداء-على-الأقل-في-ضربات-جوية-استهدفت/ 8 شهداء على الأقل في ضربات جوية استهدفت بلدة كفر داعل وقوات النظام تستعيد السيطرة على منيان] The Army then continued with its assault, attacking the nearby Minyan Sawmills and Carton Factory,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-pushes-west-minyan-suburb-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army pushes west of Minyan Suburb in Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}} and seized the factory. Fighting continued at the sawmills and the Tires Barracks.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-roll-western-aleppo-islamist-rebels-suffer-devastating-losses/|title=Syrian Army on the roll in western Aleppo as Islamist rebels suffer devastating losses|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}} Later that evening, the Army retook control of Dahiyat Al-Assad district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-seizes-important-suburb-western-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army seizes important suburb in western Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=11 November 2016|publisher=}} On 12 November, the Army attacked and captured the Sourah checkpoint, west of Dahiyat Al-Assad, turning their attention then to the northern perimeter of the Souq Al-Jabas area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-continues-rapid-advance-west-aleppo-map/|title=Syrian Army continues rapid advance in west Aleppo: map|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=12 November 2016|publisher=}}{{cite tweet|user=InsideSourceInt|author=The Inside Source|number=797340431528775680|date=12 November 2016|title=Syria // #Aleppo // Checkpoint West of Al Assad suburb is now in SAA hands.}} They also fully secured the Minyan industrial district[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=54521 Aerial escalation at the western countryside of Aleppo causes casualties and the regime forces re-control Manasher Menyan] after recapturing the Minyan Sawmills.[https://twitter.com/Syria_Hezb_Iran/status/797491996428500993] [https://twitter.com/EmmanuelGMay/status/797503340842287104] By this point, government forces had regained control of all areas lost at the start of the rebel offensive, as well as areas lost in the earlier rebel offensive during the summer campaign.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-3929668/Syrian-troops-reverse-rebel-advance-west-Aleppo.html|title=Syrian troops reverse rebel advance west of Aleppo|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://gulfnews.com/news/mena/syria/syria-regime-eroding-rebel-gains-in-aleppo-monitor-1.1928207|title=Syria regime eroding rebel gains in Aleppo: monitor|first=|last=AFP|date=12 November 2016|publisher=}} ==Aftermath== {{main|Aleppo offensive (November–December 2016)}} Following the successful campaign by pro-government forces, the rebels in eastern-Aleppo were given 24 hours to surrender before the Army started an offensive to completely recapture the rebel-held districts in the east.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-gives-jihadists-24-hours-surrender-launching-massive-offensive-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army gives jihadists 24 hours to surrender before launching massive offensive in Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=13 November 2016|publisher=}} After the offensive, food and medicine were reportedly smuggled from the [[YPG]]-held [[Sheikh Maqsood]] into rebel-held eastern Aleppo.{{cite web|url=http://english.aawsat.com/2016/11/article55362033/aleppo-deadlock-eased-kurdish-merchants|title=Aleppo Deadlock Eased by Kurdish Merchants|work=Aawsat|date=13 November 2016|access-date=14 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161114165846/http://english.aawsat.com/2016/11/article55362033/aleppo-deadlock-eased-kurdish-merchants|archive-date=14 November 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} ==International reactions== [[Amnesty International]] stated that the "armed opposition groups have displayed a shocking disregard for civilian lives", deploying weapons "whose use in the vicinity of densely populated civilian areas flagrantly violates [[laws of war|international humanitarian law]]". The organization called the rebel groups to "end all attacks that fail to distinguish between military targets and civilians".{{cite web|url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/10/syria-end-unlawful-attacks-in-western-aleppo-city-by-armed-opposition-groups/|title=Syria: Armed opposition groups must end unlawful attacks in western Aleppo|work=Amnesty|date=31 October 2016}} The [[United Nations]] special envoy for Syria, [[Staffan de Mistura]], expressed that he was "appalled and shocked" by the attacks targeting civilians in Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37816938|title=Aleppo siege: UN envoy Mistura 'appalled' by rebel attacks|date=30 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 November 2016|via=www.bbc.com}} He later stated that some rebel groups had been preventing civilians leaving eastern Aleppo.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/aleppo-battle-syrian-civil-war-latest-advance-russia-ready-for-talks-withdrawal-opposition-jihadists-a7453996.html |title=Aleppo: Russia 'ready for talks' on rebel withdrawal as Syrian forces continue advance on besieged districts |author=Lizzie Dearden |newspaper=The Independent |date=3 December 2016 |accessdate=4 December 2016}} == {{more citations|date=October 2017}} [[File:Apple Expo 20060.jpg|thumb|right|240px|Apple Expo 2006 at Hall 5, [[Parc des Expositions de Paris]].]] The '''Apple Expo''' was a European annual [[sales]] conference and [[technology]] exposition held by [[Apple Inc.]] The conference featured over 250 exhibitors annually, with Apple being its main exhibitor. This conference was most often viewed as the European counterpart to [[MacWorld Expo]], a similar conference that was held annually in San Francisco.
== History == The Apple Expo event was originally invented and held in France around 1984 by the employees of the French Apple distributor Seedrin Sarl, and its manager [[Jean-Louis Gassée]]. All the employees of this small distributor were each time involved in participating for this annual show, where several third party software and hardware distributors would also have their booth. Apple Seedrin (which turned to Apple France) continued for decades to organise this event every mid September. Within the small (100 people) Apple France subsidiary, a team was even created (with Adeline Domenjoz) to set up this event. Due to the growing size of the event, Reed OIP was contracted for show management.
Around the turn to the 21st century, the Apple corporation took the ownership of the Apple Expo organisation, and Steve Jobs included this recurring date in his possible events list. With this new corporate management, the French subsidiary employees slowly stopped being be part of the booth demo team. The last years showed that the event was slowly turning into an iPod expo, more than a Mac one. Year after year, Apple stopped releasing new products during this event, removing much of its booth investments, and limited the amount of available new products on show. The last issue was a Reed Expositions-only event, without even an Apple booth.
There were other similar events held in Europe, like [[MacExpo]] in London, but with no link with the Apple Expo.
Below there is a time line of all significant product announcements announced at the Apple Expo: <!-- Still researching the start of the Apple Expo -->
=== Timeline === {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Location ! Description |- | 2008 | Paris, France | Apple Expo Canceled. Apple said it would not participate in the Paris expo at all, saying it would be participating in fewer trade shows. |- |- | 2007 | Paris, France | 25 to 29 September. |- | 2006 | Paris, France | From 12 to 16 September at Paris expo. |- | 2005 | Paris, France | The traditional [[Stevenote|keynote]] done by Apple at both MacWorld Expo, and Apple Expo was left out. The only product announced by Apple was a new and improved [[.Mac]] bundle. |- | 2004 | Paris, France | Due to [[Steve Jobs]] having [[pancreatic cancer]], the keynote was instead done by [[Phil Schiller]], an Apple executive. Schiller announced the new [[iMac G5]]. |- | 2003 | Paris, France | Steve Jobs announced various upgrades to the [[PowerBook G4]] line of computers. As well, he announced the Apple [[Bluetooth]] wireless keyboard and mouse. |- | 2002 | Paris, France | Much of the keynote consisted of a demo of Apple's new [[Mac OS X v10.2]] operating system. Steve Jobs also announced [[iCal]] and [[iSync]]. |- | 2001 | ''N/A'' | The Apple Expo was cancelled due to the [[September 11, 2001, attacks]]. |- | 2000 | Paris, France | In this keynote the [[Mac OS X]] [[public beta]] was announced, as well a series of new [[iBook]]s. |}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20051027001520/http://www.apple-expo.com/ Former Apple Expo Official Site] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070922045511/http://www.macworldexpo.com/ MacWorld Expo Official Site] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060204152616/http://home.arcor.de/grouchosbox/keynote/ Apple Expo 2003 - Keynote Photos]
[[Category:Computer-related trade shows]]

{{Infobox holiday | |holiday_name=Asalha Puja |nickname = Dharma Day
Esala Poya (in Sri Lanka)
Dhammasekya Day (in Burma) |image=Sermon in the Deer Park depicted at Wat Chedi Liem-KayEss-1.jpeg |caption=The sermon in the Deer Park as depicted at [[Wat Chedi Liam]], Thailand |observedby= Theravada Buddhists, especially [[Cambodia]]ns, [[Laos|Lao]], [[Myanmar|Burmese]], [[Sri Lanka]]ns and [[Thailand|Thais]] |date=Full moon day of the 8th lunar month |date2015 = July 31 |date2016 = July 19 |date2017 = July 9 |date2018 = July 27 |observances= |celebrations= |type=Buddhist |significance= |relatedto= [[Esala Mangallaya]] and [[Kandy Esala Perahera]], which are held as part of Asalha Puja celebrations in Sri Lanka
Chokor Duchen Festival (in Tibet) [[Tshechu|Drukpa Tshe Zhi]] (in Bhutan) }} {{buddhism}} '''Asalha Puja''' (known as '''Asanha Bucha''' in [[Thailand]], {{lang-th|อาสาฬหบูชา}}) is a [[Theravada]] [[Buddhist festival]] which typically takes place in July, on the full moon of the eighth [[lunar month]] (the full moon of Cancer). It is celebrated in [[Cambodia]], [[Thailand]], [[Sri Lanka]], [[Laos]], [[Myanmar]] and in countries with Theravada Buddhist populations. Asalha Puja, also known as [[Dharma#Buddhism|Dhamma]] Day, is one of Theravada Buddhism's most important festivals, celebrating as it does the Buddha's first sermon in which he set out to his five former associates the doctrine that had come to him following his enlightenment. This first pivotal sermon, often referred to as “setting into motion the wheel of dhamma,” is the teaching which is encapsulated for Buddhists in the four noble truths: there is suffering ([[dukkha]]); suffering is caused by craving ([[Taṇhā|tanha]]); there is a state ([[nibbana]]) beyond suffering and craving; and finally, the way to nirvana is via [[the eightfold path]]. All the various schools and traditions of Buddhism revolve around the central doctrine of the [[Four Noble Truths|four noble truths]]. This first sermon is not only the first structured discourse given by the Buddha after his enlightenment, it also contains the essence of all his subsequent teaching. At the end of the talk, one of the five participants recounted his understanding of what had been said and asked to be received as a disciple, a request the Buddha granted, thus establishing the first order of monks. The day is observed by donating offerings to [[wat|temples]] and listening to [[sermon]]s. The following day is known in Thailand as ''{{lang-th|วันเข้าพรรษา}} [[vassa|Wan Khao Phansa]]''; it is the first day of {{lang-th|พรรษา}} [[vassa]], the Theravada rains retreat. In Indonesia, this festival is centered at Mendut Temple, near [[Borobudur]]. ==See also== *[[Vassa]] *[[Uposatha]] *[[Kandy Esala Perahera]], a tradition held in Kandy, Sri Lanka during Asalha Puja part of the [[Esala Mangallaya]] festival tradition ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.accesstoinsight.org/tipitaka/sn/sn56/sn56.011.than.html Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta] - The Buddha's first discourse *[http://chiangmaibest.com/wan-asana-bucha-wan-khao-pansa/ Wan Asana Bucha and Wan Khao Pansa in Thailand] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20130515133352/http://www.visetkaew.com/wp/about-embassy/265-2/ Holidays of the Royal Thai Embassy in Washington DC] {{Commons category|Asalha Puja}} {{Buddhism topics}} [[Category:Buddhist festivals]] [[Category:Buddhist holidays]] [[Category:Non-Gregorian July observances]] [[Category:Observances set by the Thai lunar calendar]] [[Category:Public holidays in Sri Lanka]] [[Category:Religious festivals in Thailand]] [[Category:Theravada Buddhist terminology]] [[Category:Observances set by the Burmese calendar]] [[Category:Observances held on the full moon]] {{Reli-festival-stub}} {{Buddhism-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=March 2007}}
'''Bank condition''' is a [[random variable]] used to represent the [[probability of failure]] of a bank. The true probability of failure is unknown to depositors.
[[CAMELS ratings]] in U.S. are intended to reflect the evaluation of regulators and supervisors about bank condition. These evaluations are not publicly released but only given to the bank managers.
==See also== *[[Market discipline]] *[[Too-big-to-fail]] *[[Basel II]] *[[Bank regulation]] *[[CAMELS ratings]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bank Condition}} [[Category:Bank regulation|Condition]] [[Category:Business failures]] [[Category:Mathematical finance]] [[Category:Financial risk]]

revision.comment: /* The battle at Xiao */ added some details which were not mentioned before
revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict=Battle of Xiao |partof=[[Spring and Autumn Period]] |date=April, 627 BC |place=Mountain Xiao (in western [[Henan]]) |result=Jin defeated Qin |image = Battle of Xiao.png |caption = Battle of Xiao between Qin and Jin |combatant1=[[Qin (state)|State of Qin]] |combatant2=[[Jin (Chinese state)|State of Jin]] |commander1=[[Baili Mengming]]
[[Xi Qi Shu]]
[[Bai Yibing]] |commander2=[[Xian Zhen]] |strength1=about 500,000 |strength2=about 100,000 |casualties1= 30,000 |casualties2=unknown }} The '''Battle of Xiao''' or '''Yao''' ({{zh|t=殽之戰}}) was a battle between [[Qin (state)|Qin]] and [[Jin (Chinese state)|Jin]], both of which were major principality states during the [[Spring and Autumn Period]] of [[Zhou dynasty]]. It occurred in 627 BC at the [[Xiao Mountains]], a branch of the [[Qinling]] Range between [[Yellow River]] and [[Luo River (Henan)|Luo River]], in modern-day [[Henan province]] of China. == Before the Battle == In 632 BC, the [[Battle of Chengpu]] broke out between [[Jin (Chinese state)|Jin]] and [[Chu (state)|Chu]]. Chu was defeated, and the [[Duke Wen of Jin]] became one of [[Five Hegemons|Five Hegemons of Spring and Autumn Period]]. [[Zheng (state)|State of Zheng]] was an ally of Chu, so after the battle, Jin planned to invade Zheng for revenge. In 630, Jin attacked Zheng and besieged its capital city. [[Qin (state)|Qin]] also joined the force of Jin as Duke Mu of Qin was a follower to the Duke Wen of Jin. [[Zhu Zhiwu]], a person from Zheng, visited [[Duke Mu of Qin]] at night. He told the Duke Mu of Qin that if Zheng was conquered, there would be no benefit to Qin because they did not share a border at that time. On the other hand, Jin would occupy Zheng's territory. It would make Jin stronger and a greater threat to Qin. He pointed out that if Qin gave up attacking the city, Zheng would be willing to be an ally of Qin in the future to potentially fight against Jin. He successfully persuaded Duke Mu of Qin to retreat. Before going back, Duke Mu of Qin appointed three generals to stay at Zheng in order to help Zheng defend their capital city. Since then, the ally between Qin and Jin did not exist any more.[[s:燭之武退秦師|烛之武退秦师（左传）]]：晉侯、秦伯圍鄭，以其無禮於晉，且貳於楚也。晉軍函陵，秦軍氾南。......夜縋而出。見秦伯曰：「秦、晉圍鄭，鄭既知亡矣。若亡鄭而有益于君，敢以煩執事。越國以鄙遠，君知其難也。焉用亡鄭以陪鄰？鄰之厚，君之薄也。若舍鄭以為東道主，行李之往來，共其乏困，君亦無所害。且君嘗為晉君賜矣，許君焦、瑕，朝濟而夕設版焉，君之所知也。夫晉，何厭之有？既東封鄭，又欲肆其西封。若不闕秦，將焉取之？闕秦以利晉，唯君圖之。」秦伯說，與鄭人盟，使杞子、逢孫、楊孫戍之，乃還。 Jin failed to conquer Zheng because of the absence of Qin. Two years later, Duke Wen of Jin died. His son succeed the crown as Duke Xiang of Jin. Meanwhile, state Qin gradually became stronger under Duke Mu's reign. Qin defeated several small states and extended its territory towards Zheng. As Zheng was not so far away anymore, Qin began to think about conquering Zheng. At this time, those three generals stayed with Zheng sent a message to Qin that if the army of Qin attacked Zheng, they would open the northern gate of Zheng's capital city to coordinate with the campaign. [[s:蹇叔哭師|蹇叔哭師（左传）]]：杞子自鄭使告於秦，曰：「鄭人使我掌其北門之管，若潛師以來，國可得也。」 [[Jian Shu]], a governor of Qin, disliked the idea of attacking Zheng. He asked Duke Mu to abandon this plan because it might cause potential crisis. However, Duke Mu had made his mind and continued the plan. [[s:蹇叔哭師|蹇叔哭師（左传）]]：蹇叔曰：「勞師以襲遠，非所聞也。師勞力竭，遠主備之，無乃不可乎！師之所為，鄭必知之；勤而無所，必有悖心。且行千里，其誰不知？」公辭焉，召孟明、西乞、白乙，使出師于東門之外。蹇叔哭之，曰：「孟子！吾見師之出，而不見其入也！」公使謂之曰：「爾何知？中壽，爾墓之木拱矣。」 In 627 BC, the duke appointed Baili Mengming (son of [[Baili Xi]]), Xi Wi Shu and Bai Yibing as generals to launch a surprise attack to Zheng. To enter the territory of Zheng, Qin army had to pass by the northern gate of [[Luoyang]], the city in which the king of [[Zhou dynasty|Zhou]] lives. The king of Zhou was regarded as the son of heaven. According to traditional manners, soldiers needed to take off their hamlets when passing by the city of Luoyang. Qin soldiers, however, did not do so. People in the city were astonished, and some people pointed out that Qin soldiers could not win the war because they were too arrogant. [[s:崤之战|崤之战（左传）]]：三十三年春，秦师过周北门，左右免胃而下，超乘者三百乘。王孙满尚幼，观之，言于王曰：“秦师轻而无礼，必败。轻则寡谋，无礼则脱。入险而脱，又不能谋，能无败乎？” When the Qin army reached [[Hua (state)|State of Hua]], a hunter from Zheng noticed them. The hunter knew that there was not enough time for him to run back to Zheng to warm everybody, so he decided to fool the Qin army on his own. He paid tribute to generals of Qin in the name of Zheng. After receiving the tribute, generals of Qin thought that Zheng knew they were coming and was well prepared for the war, so they gave up the plan of attacking Zheng. Instead, they conquered Hua and retreated. In reality, Zheng did not know anything about the coming Qin army. == The battle at Xiao == The [[Duke Xiang of Jin]] learned what Qin was trying to do. He was annoyed because he knew that Qin was not only trying to conquer Zheng but also trying to challenge the authority of Jin. To give Qin a lesson, Duke Xiang of Jin allied with the Jiang Rong tribe (a [[Xirong|Rong]] people living in the [[Hanshui|Han River]] valley) to launch a campaign against Qin. They planned to ambush Qin in the Xiao Mountains which was on the route of Qin's retreat. The army of Qin led by those three generals were still retreating from Hua, and they were not prepared to fight against the mighty Jin. These two forces collided at Xiao. Jin army was superior and easily won the battle. Three generals of Qin were all captured by Jin. After that, Wen Ying, who was a concubine of Duke Wen of Jin, also a daughter of Duke Mu of Qin, entreated Duke Xiang of Jin to release the three generals so that they would be punished in Qin, which was the desire of Duke Mu of Qin as she said. Her entreaty was accepted by Duke Xiang of Jin and the three generals were released and went back to Qin later. When the Qin army returned, Duke Mu of Qin put on white clothes to wait for them, crying that it was all his fault because he had not listened to Jian Shu's advice. Therefore, the three generals were not punished by Duke Mu of Qin. As a result of this battle, Jin solidified its status as the most powerful state in northern China for next several decades. Qin suffered a significant loss. About 30,000 men, most of who were elite soldiers in the army, were killed in the battle. For a long period of time after the battle, Qin had no power to continue its eastward expansion. Instead, they turned around and began to expand towards the west. During this process, they clashed with several barbarians and nomadic groups and conquered several smaller states in the west and northwest. The westward expansion helped Qin to build up its power and laid the root for its being a strong state and the [[Qin's wars of unification|eventual unification]] of China. == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:627 BC]] [[Category:Jin (Chinese state)]] [[Category:Qin (state)]] [[Category:7th century BC in China]] [[Category:History of Henan]] [[Category:Spring and Autumn period]]

{{Inline|date=June 2015}} [[File:California State Fair 2013.jpg|thumb|California State Fair in July 2013]] The '''California Exposition and State Fair (Cal Expo)''' is an independent state agency established by law in the California Food and Agriculture codes. Cal Expo is governed by an appointed 11-member Board of Directors and daily operations are managed by the chief executive officer (selected by the Board). During the annual [[State_fair|State Fair]] more than 2,000 seasonal temporary employees are hired. The California Exposition is a self-sufficient operation that receives no government funding but still has an estimated economic impact of more than $250 million on the region.
==History== The [[California State Legislature|California legislature]] created the State Agricultural Society to promote California's reputation for farming and industry. An agricultural exposition was organized and held in [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco]] in 1854, and California Historic Landmark #861 marks the site. Given that travel was difficult in that era, the next several annual expositions were moved around the state, to [[Sacramento, California|Sacramento]], [[San Jose, California|San Jose]], [[Stockton, California|Stockton]], and [[Marysville, California|Marysville]].
In 1859 the exposition returned to Sacramento, and it was decided that a permanent site should be found. Capitol Park, a six block site bounded by E, H, 20th and 22nd Streets ({{coord|38.580|N|121.477|W}}) was purchased and was home to the state fair for the next fifty years.
Growth in population and attendance forced the purchase of {{convert|80|acre|m2}} just outside the city limits on Stockton Boulevard ({{coord|38.552|N|121.452|W}}), and the first fair was held there in 1909. Continued growth caused that site to be expanded by {{convert|75|acre|m2}} in 1937. During and after [[World War II]], from 1942 to 1947, the Fair was suspended and the fairgrounds were occupied by the [[United States Army|Army]]. During its formative years(1929-1942?), the [[California Highway Patrol]] used some of the State Fair facilities as an unofficial "training academy", later using other state-owned areas in the Sacramento area for training use until the current CHP Academy was opened in 1976.
In 1948, the state purchased approximately 900 acres of undeveloped land along the [[American River]] north of downtown Sacramento. Funds were not allocated to begin construction on this land until 1963, and the State Fair continued at the Stockton Boulevard grounds until 1967. In 1968, Governor [[Ronald Reagan]] opened the new "Cal Expo" site, which covers over {{convert|350|acre|km2}} of developed land at {{coord|38.593|N|121.435|W}}.
Cal Expo has seen limited changes over the years. Following the tragic attacks of [[September_11_attacks|9/11]], a memorial plaza was installed in 2002. In 2012, the [[Disneyland Resort]] donated to Cal Expo the iconic 'CALIFORNIA' letters that previously stood in front of [[Disney California Adventure]] from its 2001 opening until 2011. The letters now stand at the entrance to the Expo.
In addition to the annual State Fair, Cal Expo hosts a number of other community, trade and business events, including the annual State Fair Gala (supporting scholarships), Sacramento County Fair, International Sportsman Expo, Western States Horse Expo and a number of other RV, auto and special collectible trade shows.
The one-mile dirt racetrack at Cal Expo hosts live thoroughbred racing during the annual State Fair and live harness racing (September through May), in addition to special events like the Sacramento Mile Auto-race.{{cn|date=June 2015}} The old [[California State Fairgrounds Race Track]] hosted [[USAC National Championship]] races.
==California State Fair== ===Features=== ====''Monorail''==== {{unsourced|section|date=June 2015}} Cal Expo is home to one of two operating permanent monorail system in California - the only other can be found at Disneyland. The iconic monorail was installed during the creation of its existing grounds in 1968 by Universal Mobility Incorporated. The Monorail ride is only open for public use during the annual State Fair and is a great way to see the grounds from above. The storage facility for the monorail trams are located in the northwest corner of the grounds. Each tram features a different California symbol, like the California Golden Poppy or California Quail.
====''Magnificent Midway''==== {{unsourced|section|date=June 2015}} Carnival rides and games are operated by [[Butler Amusements|Butler Amusements, Inc.]] Butler Amusements' first year at the state fair was in 2009. Rides and games were operated by RCS Amusements for a number of years before that.
==External links== *[http://www.bigfun.org Official web site of the California State Fair] *[http://www.funnevergrowsold.com/ Promotional web site] *[http://www.cdfa.ca.gov/fe/ CDFA Division of Fairs and Expositions (governing body)] *[http://www.noehill.com/sf/landmarks/cal0861.asp California Historic Landmark 861] *[http://www.virtualemotion.com/vt/calexpo_virtual_tour/TourWeaver_calexpo.html California State Fair Virtual Tour (Java)] *[http://www.calxharness.com/ Cal Expo Horse Racing]
{{coord|38.59337|-121.434765|region:US_type:landmark|display=title}}
[[Category:State fairs]] [[Category:Fairs in California]] [[Category:Annual fairs]] [[Category:Annual events in California]] [[Category:Agriculture in California]] [[Category:August events]] [[Category:September events]] [[Category:Culture of Sacramento, California]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Sacramento, California]] [[Category:UM people movers]] [[Category:Festivals established in 1854]] [[Category:1854 establishments in California]]

page.title: Continuing United Kingdom relationship with the European Union

revision.text:
[[File:Political System of the European Union.svg|thumb|400px|Political system of the European Union]] {{Brexit}}
The '''[[United Kingdom]]'s post-[[Brexit]] relationship with the remaining [[European Union]] members''' could take several forms. A research paper presented to the UK Parliament in July 2013 proposed a number of alternatives to membership which would continue to allow access to the [[European Single Market|EU internal market]]. These include remaining in the [[European Economic Area]] (EEA) as a [[European Free Trade Association]] (EFTA) member (alongside [[Iceland]], [[Liechtenstein]], and [[Norway]]), or seeking to negotiate bilateral terms more akin to the [[Switzerland–European Union relations|Swiss model]] with a series of interdependent sectoral agreements.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=http://www.parliament.uk/briefing-papers/rp13-42.pdf|title=Leaving the EU – RESEARCH PAPER 13/42|date=1 July 2013|accessdate=19 May 2015|publisher=House of Commons Library}}</ref> The exit from the EU without EEA membership or a trade agreement is known as the WTO option.
A transitional arrangement may apply between the time the UK leaves the EU and the coming into force of the final relationship. The report from the first phase of [[Brexit negotiations]] (June to December 2017) mentioned the possibility of agreeing a transitional arrangement during the second phase.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ec.europa.eu/commission/sites/beta-political/files/joint_report.pdf|title=Joint report from the negotiators of the European Union and the United Kingdom Government on progress during phase 1 of negotiations under Article 50 TEU on the United Kingdom's orderly withdrawal from the European Union|last=|first=|date=8 December 2017|website=European Commission|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref>
==UK membership of the European Economic Area== {{main|Membership of United Kingdom in the European Economic Area}}
The UK could seek to continue to be a member of the European Economic Area as a member of EFTA. In January 2017, [[Theresa May]], the [[British Prime Minister]], announced a 12-point plan of negotiating objectives and said that the UK government would not seek continued membership in the [[European Single Market|single market]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/01/17/theresa-may-brexit-12-point-plan-live/|title=Theresa May confirms Britain will leave Single Market as she sets out 12-point Brexit plan.|last=Wilkinson|first=Michael|date=17 January 2017|work=The Daily Telegraph|access-date=18 January 2017}}</ref> EEA membership would mean being under existing EU internal market legislation that is part of the [[EEA Agreement]]. Some EU law originates from various international bodies on which non-EU EEA countries have a seat. EFTA members are free to set their own policies in areas such as [[Common Agricultural Policy|agriculture]], [[Common Fisheries Policy|fisheries]], [[European Union Customs Union|Customs Union]], [[Common Commercial Policy (EU)|trade]], the [[Common Foreign and Security Policy]], direct and indirect taxation and [[Police and Judicial Co-operation in Criminal Matters|criminal matters]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The Basic Features of the EEA Agreement|publisher=European Free Trade Association|url=http://www.efta.int/eea/eea-agreement/eea-basic-features.aspx|accessdate=8 August 2013}}</ref> EEA countries are required to contribute to the [[EU Budget]] in exchange for access to the internal market.<ref name="europequestion">{{cite journal|last1=Glencross|first1=Andrew|title=Why a British referendum on EU membership will not solve the Europe question|journal=International Affairs|date=March 2015|volume=91|issue=2|pages=303–17|doi=10.1111/1468-2346.12236|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/1468-2346.12236/abstract}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=EEA EFTA Budget|url=http://www.efta.int/eea/eu-programmes/application-finances/eea-efta-budget|publisher=EFTA|accessdate=14 February 2016}}</ref> The UK would be subject to the [[EFTA Court]] rather than the [[European Court of Justice]].<ref name="allenovery.com">[http://www.allenovery.com/Brexit-Law/Documents/Macro/EU/AO_BrexitLaw_-_EEA_Membership_Jul_2016.PDF] "A&O Legal Opinion on EEA membership"</ref>
==Bilateral deals==
Seeking to negotiate bilateral terms more along the [[Switzerland–European Union relations|Swiss model]] with a series of interdependent sectoral agreements.<ref name="auto"/> Britain has not negotiated a trade agreement since before 1973, and the government is looking to the private sector for assistance.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://next.ft.com/content/7ccfd858-41e0-11e6-b22f-79eb4891c97d |title=Britain turns to private sector for complex Brexit talks |work=Financial Times |date =4 July 2016 |accessdate=5 July 2016 |author1=Parker|author2= George}}</ref>
==WTO option== The [[WTO]] option would involve the United Kingdom leaving the European Union without any [[Free Trade Agreement]] and relying on the trading rules set by the [[World Trade Organization]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://leavehq.com/blogview.aspx?blogno=128|title=What’s wrong with the WTO Option?|first=|last=LeaveHQ|website=leavehq.com}}</ref>
==Immigration==
The EEA Agreement and the agreement with Switzerland cover free movement of goods, and [[Free Movement Directive|free movement of people]].<ref>[http://www.efta.int/eea/policy-areas/capital "Free Movement of Capital"], "EFTA". Retrieved 24 June 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.efta.int/eea/policy-areas/persons "Free Movement of Persons"], "EFTA". Retrieved 24 June 2016.</ref> Many supporters of Brexit want to restrict freedom of movement;<ref>Grose, Thomas. [https://www.usnews.com/news/best-countries/articles/2016-06-16/anger-at-immigration-fuels-the-uks-brexit-movement "Anger at Immigration Fuels the UK's Brexit Movement"], ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'', Washington, D.C., 16 June 2016. Retrieved 24 June 2016.</ref> Liechtenstein has a de facto permanent limit on the free movement of persons, though the [[EEA Joint Committee]] said this was because of Liechtenstein's specific geographical situation.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.ceps.eu/system/files/EEA%20Review_Liechtenstein%20Final.pdf|title=The EEA Review and Liechtenstein's Integration Strategy|last=Pelkmans|first=Jacques|last2=Bohler|publisher=Centre for European Policy Studies|year=2013|isbn=978-94-6138-287-0|location=Brussels|page=34|quote=The EEA Council recognises that Liechtenstein has a very small inhabitable area of rural character with an unusually high percentage of non-national residents and employees. Moreover, it acknowledges the vital interest of Liechtenstein to maintain its own national identity.|via=}}</ref> Also, an EEA Agreement would include free movement for EU and EEA citizens, although the EEA Agreement allows EEA EFTA states to suspend it temporarily due to serious economic, societal or environmental difficulties.<ref>http://www.allenovery.com/Brexit-Law/Documents/Macro/EU/AO_BrexitLaw_-_EEA_Membership_Jul_2016.PDF</ref> Passport systems allow EEA institutions to access markets in EU Member States, for the most part, without having to establish subsidiaries in each EU Member State and incur the costs of full authorisation in those jurisdiction.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Brennand|first1=David A.|last2=Jackson|first2=Carolyn H.|last3=Lalone|first3=Nathaniel W.|last4=Robson|first4=Neil|last5=Sugden|first5=Peter|title=Brexit: Implications for the Financial Services Industry|url=http://www.natlawreview.com/article/brexit-implications-financial-services-industry|accessdate=28 June 2016|work=The National Law Review|publisher=Katten Muchin Rosenman LLP|date=24 June 2016}}</ref> Others{{Who|date=June 2016}} present ideas of a [[Switzerland–European Union relations|Swiss solution]], that is tailor-made agreements between the UK and the EU, but EU representatives have claimed they would not support such a solution.{{Citation needed|date=June 2016}} The Swiss agreements contain free movement for EU citizens.<ref>{{cite web|title=Agreement with the Swiss Federation: free movement of persons|url=http://europa.eu/legislation_summaries/internal_market/living_and_working_in_the_internal_market/em0025_en.htm|publisher=European Commission|accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref> (The [[Swiss immigration referendum, February 2014]] voted narrowly in favour of an end to the 'free movement' agreement, by February 2017. However, the [[Switzerland–European Union relations|bilateral treaties between Switzerland and the European Union]] are all co-dependent: if one is terminated then all are terminated. Consequently, should Switzerland choose unilaterally to cancel the 'free movement' agreement then all its agreements with the EU will lapse unless a compromise is found. A compromise was reached in December 2016, effectively canceling quotas on EU citizens but still allowing for favorable treatment of Swiss-based job applicants c).<ref name=euobserver22216>[https://euobserver.com/justice/136398 EU and Switzerland agree on free movement] ''[[EUobserver]]'', 22 December 2016</ref>
Several thousand British citizens resident in other EU countries have after the referendum applied for citizenship where they live, since they fear losing the right to work there.<ref>{{cite web|author=Sophia Schirmer |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/oct/19/huge-increase-britons-seeking-citizenship-eu-states-brexit-looms |title=Huge increase in Britons seeking citizenship in EU states as Brexit looms |publisher=The Guardian |date=19 October 2016|accessdate=24 February 2017}}</ref>
==Governance== An EU position paper stated: “The Withdrawal Agreement should establish institutional arrangements to ensure the effective management, implementation and enforcement of the Agreement. It should include appropriate dispute settlement mechanisms regarding the application and interpretation of the Withdrawal Agreement. The Withdrawal Agreement should respect the Union's autonomy. The Withdrawal Agreement should provide that both The Union and the United Kingdom supervise the implementation of the Withdrawal Agreement.”<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ec.europa.eu/commission/publications/position-paper-transmitted-eu27-governance_en|title=Position paper transmitted to EU27 on Governance|website=European Commission - European Commission}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
